instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
So this machine runs fine battery is detected and charging.

issue is it wont turn on unless power adapter is plugged in.

I cannot pinpoint the issue any ideas? This board had prior water damage and was cleaned by someone else.

seems like the power button is unresponsive until adapter is plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: Will it run off of the battery? If so, try another keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
it runs off of battery and charges just fine. keyboard is fully responsive its just when its turned off and unplugged that it wont respond to the power button.

also tested in a known good machine and same issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
Yes it is and noticed that once i shut it down it wont respond to power button but it will respond if i hold power button for 5 seconds.

replaced isl and nothing changed lines and resistors to bmon and amon are fine. Even reflowed smc still no change. Could smc be bad or maybe bad caps on amon bmon?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: Run diagnostics and check for corroded resistors/traces around the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
ASD returns no errors traces and resistors have no corrosion tested traces all are ok.

swapped smc and its still exhibiting the same behavior only now it wont turn on if i hold the power button for 5 seconds only when i unplug battery and drain power by holding power for 10 seconds. re-plugging and pressing power.

I also noticed that when i dont boot into an operating system and i shut it off whether it be after entering asd, boot menu or waiting for folder icon with no hard drive plugged in  it will still turn on every time. only when booting into an operating system and shutting off it wont turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
I think OSX will set something in NVRAM to remember the shutdown.
Other way machine starts itself when charger is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message:
hmm how could i clear this programming maybe running a reinstall of the OS?

ill try that.

update: reinstall changed nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: PRAM reset done? Same issue when shorting the power pads on the board to rule out a bad keyboard. Check voltage on the power pads too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: Yeah same issue with power pads so not the keyboard. I have since returned the laptop to the customer but wish we could have solved it. Ill save the thread for next time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: Was this ever solved? I have the same board same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on while unplugged
threads.message: sorry, customer decided to take it back was not able to figure it out.
